became blacksmith by trade Upon reaching maturity he escaped
the North where he early embraced the opportunities for learn
He developed unusually bright scholar in Creek Latin
and Cerman and manifested inclination for the study Of
theology which he showed much proficiency Impressed with his
worth educated we'll trained for the ministry the Presby
terans ordained him
neccu where he served years. He later became the
of the Shiloh Church in New York City.

NEGRO HISTORY NOTES
Dr.. Penning ton

Office the IlESC Week III WAY
a hundred or more workers Of
various trades and industries
have been either inside or out
side our East Broadway domicile.


Under the supervision of Peter
Roosen. designer and construc-
ton contractor and his brother,
Adrien, the addition to our home
is being completed. We are al
ready enjoying the spacious fam
ily-office room. am working In
1t today. No longer will have
to roll my faithful machine from
the office room, formerly bed
room through the living room.


Now the bedroom will be re-
furnished as bedroom. The file
cabinet waits to be moved and the
large desk waits to be sold.


Refurnishing the house and re-
modelling have made me a fur
niture sales authority. Not only
am | we'll versed in kinds Of
woods. types Of carpets, makes
Of light fixtures. but am also
becoming a floor tile expert.


All houses are not homes until
you actually live in them. Give
some blood, sweat and tears over
them. Little by little the rec
tangle of wood, mortar, bricks
and glass takes over your entire
body. soul and mind.


The color Of wall, the tex
ture of a drape, the content
of a piece of floor tile can make
you happy or make you sad.


The house located at 2137 East
Broadway Road. resembled many
other houses in the city. But,
once we started altering its ap-
pearances inside and outside
something happened. No longer
was the place without life.
The house almost breathed.


Suddenly nothing went right.
There was day when nothing
was correct. The tile was
crooked, the bell was soundless,
the light cord was broken when
installed and the kitchen curtain
was not delivered.


Oh, we'll today is another day
home is not only sweet, but home
is full Of my sweat and my
spouses's fret. We only want to
be like Great Garbo--alone at
home.


The building Is we'll adapted
to our existing part and all in
all everything will turn out we'll.
After all a little discomfort is
a small thing compared to the
comfort and beauty which we have
around us now.

Twenty June sixth thousands thousands
OF pieces of matere against Hes forces from
the beaches Of Normandy, province in France


The Allies forward overwhelming
the end of the
dable front. af7r


Thousands Of Allied killed and MANNED the first
day. but their determination spite all odds
for the last year Of fighting in World War Two. III


Two decades have and the world has
in however there danger troubled
Once before DDay many ignore warning signs
of German aggression--these attitudes still prevail.


We afford Venam and lose 200
while the knocking plans of neutrality





The lesson June 9th DDay should be remembered. Eventually
small srmishes and small battles uncomfortable.

AMo REVIEWS


Edward Banks
